channel.title: Code Development on Project notebook for the Invasion Heterogeneity project
channel.description: Recent content in Code Development on Project notebook for the Invasion Heterogeneity project

item.title: More on distributions
item.description: temp <- filter(disperseLer, ID == "100_0") cens_data <- cens_dispersal_data(temp, 7) Generalized gamma I’ve made a specialized start function for gengamma: start_gengamma function (x, truncated = FALSE) { if (dim(as.matrix(x))[2] != 2) { stop("Only interval-censored methods have been developed in start_gengamma") } dist_list <- c("lnorm", "weibull", "gamma") n <- length(dist_list) base_fits <- data.frame(dist = dist_list, AIC = numeric(n), p1 = numeric(n), p2 = numeric(n), stringsAsFactors = FALSE) base_starts <- array(list(NULL), n) if (truncated) { stop("Truncated methods have not yet been developed in start_gengamma") } for (i in 1:n) { fit <- fitdistcens(x, base_fits$dist[i], base_starts[[i]]) base_fits$AIC[i] <- fit$aic base_fits$p1[i] <- coef(fit)[1] base_fits$p2[i] <- coef(fit)[2] } best <- base_fits[which.

item.title: fitdistrplus fixed
item.description: The developers of fitdistrplus got back to me already with a code fix. The new version (1.0-12) is available from R-forge using install.packages("fitdistrplus", repos="http://R-Forge.R-project.org") So now with fitdistrplus loaded in global.dcf I can run mydata <- rnorm(20, 0, 10) mydata_cens <- data.frame(left = floor(mydata), right = ceiling(mydata)) dmynorm <- function(x, mean, sd, log = FALSE) dnorm(x, mean, sd, log) pmynorm <- function(q, mean, sd, lower.tail = TRUE, log.p = FALSE) pnorm(q, mean, sd, lower.

item.title: fitdistrplus bug
item.description: I’ve sent a bug report to the maintainer of fitdistrplus. Here’s the MRE I provided: # Generate some data mydata <- rnorm(20, 0, 10) mydata_cens <- data.frame(left = floor(mydata), right = ceiling(mydata)) # Confirm that they can be fit by "norm" library(fitdistrplus) fitdist(mydata, "norm") Fitting of the distribution ' norm ' by maximum likelihood Parameters: estimate Std. Error mean 0.9049781 2.634855 sd 11.7834301 1.863124 fitdistcens(mydata_cens, "norm") Fitting of the distribution ' norm ' on censored data by maximum likelihood Parameters: estimate mean 0.

item.title: rmutil and fitdistrplus
item.description: Warning in .check.version(config): Your configuration is compatible with version 0.8 of the ProjectTemplate package. Please run ProjectTemplate::migrate.project() to migrate to the installed version 0.8.2. So the fix I did last week to computegetparam() (to allow “y” as an argument to the distribution functions) does allow fitdist to work (sort of) with the rmutil distributions. However, there can still be failures in estimatation or SE calculation, because there are a number of other ways that the rmutil distributions work differntly from the base distribution functions.
